headline: Almost Everything Is Rallying Ahead of Fed Decision. What’s Not Matters More.
summary: The closest it got was on July 11, 2024 when the index fell 0.9% and 396 stocks gained, according to Dow Jones Market Data.  On that day, it was Tesla, Lam Research, Nvidia, Applied Materials, and Micron that dragged on the index.  This time around Broadcom, Palantir Technologies, and Nvidia were the among the big laggards, but Microsoft, Alphabet, Meta Platforms, Tesla, and Amazon.com were also dragging on the index.

headline: Is Micron (MU) a Buy as Wall Street Analysts Look Optimistic?
summary: Based on the average brokerage recommendation (ABR), Micron (MU) should be added to one's portfolio. Wall Street analysts' overly optimistic recommendations cast doubt on the effectiveness of this highly sought-after metric. So, is the stock worth buying?

headline: Is Micron Technology (MU) Still Fairly Valued After Its Recent Share Price Surge?
summary: If you are holding shares of Micron Technology (MU) or eyeing the stock from the sidelines, the recent market move probably has your attention. While there has not been a single headline-grabbing event tied to Micron just now, the steady climb in its share price over the past month is enough to spark some curiosity about what the market might be signaling. With new interest swirling around semiconductor valuations, investors naturally want to know if Micron is set for further gains or if...

headline: Why Analysts See Micron (MU) Benefiting From the AI Data Center Boom
summary: Micron Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ:MU) is one of the Trending AI Stocks on Wall Street. On September 11, Citi analysts raised their price target on the stock to $175 from $150 and reiterated their “Buy” rating. The rating affirmation comes after an increase in demand for dynamic random-access memory (DRAM) chips and the company’s artificial intelligence exposure. […]
